heisig_chinese_memo: Somebody was just looking for you. He had a longnose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. (greenapple,16-3-2006) The way to remember that this is somebody rather than someone (#1256) is that the story is full of body descriptions.
heisig_story: The key word somebody was chosen to convey the double meaning of this kanji: body and person. Its composition is based on the nose (which, you will recall, is also the kanji for oneself). The extension of the bottom and far right strokes of that element, together with the unusual diagonal stroke, forms the pictograph of somebody with a prominent paunch.

Sure, itâ€™s yourself whoâ€™s tumbling down the slideâ€¦ at least thatâ€™s how it feels to you. Who are you? What are you? All you know is youâ€™re somebody, but you donâ€™t know who that somebody is.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Apparently, youâ€™re having some kind of internal crisis. Come up with a rough one and youâ€™ll remember this kanji better.

humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen protrudes from the " person " on the abdomen (indicated by â—). â—A sign indicating a semicircle, indicating the location of the abdomen, or adding a point in the semicircle, like a belly button. The original meaning is the abdomen. "easy. "Gen Gua": "Gen Qishen", Yu Fan's note: "Body, belly." Later, a short diagonal or short horizontal line was added under the human body as a pen. The original meaning of " body " is the abdomen. Later, the meaning of the word was extended to "have body" by referring to pregnancy, "The Book of Songs. Daya. "Da Ming": "Da Ren has body, this life is King Wen" (Da Ren is Zhou Wen Wang's mother). The meaning of the word expands to have the meaning of body, and then expands to refer to the whole body from the top of the head to the toes. The word " body " is extended to " bow " in "Shuowen", which means oneself. "Said Wen": "Body, èº³ also. Like a human body. From the human, ğ ‚† sound. All the body belongs to the body."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning to indicate the abdomen. "Zhen Ji" 822 is: "Zhen: Wang Ji's body, éš¹(Ui) dagger (å¦£) own harm", means that Shang Wang has a stomach disease, which may be caused by his own.

Bronze text means body, Shi Kezhen: "To defend (to defend) the king's body, to act as a claw." It means to protect the king of Zhou and his personal guard.ã ± Public Pot: "Forever protect one's body." It also means personally, Zhongshan Wangding: "Shen Qin Shi Ji", which means to do it personally for the people of the country, and work hard in politics. It also refers to the age of the body, the Geng Ke: "in the body of the Lord of Ling" refers to the world of the Lord of Ling.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period represent the body, "Guodian Jane. "Laozi B" Jane 8: "Love takes the body as the world", which means to govern the world with an attitude of caring for the body. "Lao Tzu. Chapter Thirteen: "Love regards the body as the world." "Tsinghua Jane One. "Cheng Mao" Jane 9: "Can (how) love the non-body", which means that besides the body, what else is worth cherishing?

The seal of the seal is also known as " faith ", "Ancient Seal Compilation" 4660: "Words and bodies (faith)", referring to words but having faith. "The Analects. Zilu: "Words must be believed."
